pkgmetadata.longdescription: # Homoglyphs![Homoglyphs logo](logo.png)[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/orsinium/homoglyphs.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/orsinium/homoglyphs) [![PyPI version](https://img.shields.io/pypi/v/homoglyphs.svg)](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/homoglyphs) [![Status](https://img.shields.io/pypi/status/homoglyphs.svg)](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/homoglyphs) [![Code size](https://img.shields.io/github/languages/code-size/orsinium/homoglyphs.svg)](https://github.com/orsinium/homoglyphs) [![License](https://img.shields.io/pypi/l/homoglyphs.svg)](LICENSE)Homoglyphs -- python library for getting [homoglyphs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homoglyph) and converting to ASCII.## FeaturesIt's smarter version of [confusable_homoglyphs](https://github.com/vhf/confusable_homoglyphs):* Autodect or manual choosing category ([aliases from ISO 15924](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_15924#List_of_codes)).* Auto or manual load only needed alphabets in memory.* Converting to ASCII.* More configurable.* More stable.## Installation```bashsudo pip install homoglyphs```## UsageBest way to explain something is show how it works. So, let's have a look on the real usage.Importing:```pythonimport homoglyphs as hg```### Languages```python#detecthg.Languages.detect('w')# {'pl', 'da', 'nl', 'fi', 'cz', 'sr', 'pt', 'it', 'en', 'es', 'sk', 'de', 'fr', 'ro'}hg.Languages.detect('Ñ‚')# {'mk', 'ru', 'be', 'bg', 'sr'}hg.Languages.detect('.')# set()# get alphabet for languageshg.Languages.get_alphabet(['ru'])# {'Ğ²', 'Ğ', 'Ğš', 'Ğ¢', ..., 'Ğ ', 'Ğ—', 'Ğ­'}# get all languageshg.Languages.get_all()# {'nl', 'lt', ..., 'de', 'mk'}```### CategoriesCategories -- ([aliases from ISO 15924](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_15924#List_of_codes)).```python#detecthg.Categories.detect('w')# 'LATIN'hg.Categories.detect('Ñ‚')# 'CYRILLIC'hg.Categories.detect('.')# 'COMMON'# get alphabet for categorieshg.Categories.get_alphabet(['CYRILLIC'])# {'Ó—', 'ÔŒ', 'Ò', 'Ğ¯', ..., 'Ğ­', 'Ô•', 'Ó»'}# get all categorieshg.Categories.get_all()# {'RUNIC', 'DESERET', ..., 'SOGDIAN', 'TAI_LE'}```### HomoglyphsGet homoglyphs:```python# get homoglyphs (latin alphabet initialized by default)hg.Homoglyphs().get_combinations('q')# ['q', 'ğª', 'ğ‘', 'ğ’’', 'ğ“†', 'ğ“º', 'ğ”®', 'ğ•¢', 'ğ––', 'ğ—Š', 'ğ—¾', 'ğ˜²', 'ğ™¦', 'ğšš']```Alphabet loading:```python# load alphabet on init by categorieshomoglyphs = hg.Homoglyphs(categories=('LATIN', 'COMMON', 'CYRILLIC')) # alphabet loaded herehomoglyphs.get_combinations('Ğ³Ñ‹')# ['rÑ‹', 'Ğ³Ñ‹', 'ê­‡Ñ‹', 'ê­ˆÑ‹', 'ğ«Ñ‹', 'ğ‘ŸÑ‹', 'ğ’“Ñ‹', 'ğ“‡Ñ‹', 'ğ“»Ñ‹', 'ğ”¯Ñ‹', 'ğ•£Ñ‹', 'ğ–—Ñ‹', 'ğ—‹Ñ‹', 'ğ—¿Ñ‹', 'ğ˜³Ñ‹', 'ğ™§Ñ‹', 'ğš›Ñ‹']# load alphabet on init by languageshomoglyphs = hg.Homoglyphs(languages={'ru', 'en'}) # alphabet will be loaded herehomoglyphs.get_combinations('Ğ³Ñ‹')# ['rÑ‹', 'Ğ³Ñ‹']# manual set alphabet on init # eng rushomoglyphs = hg.Homoglyphs(alphabet='abc Ğ°Ğ±Ñ')homoglyphs.get_combinations('Ñ')# ['c', 'Ñ']# load alphabet on demandhomoglyphs = hg.Homoglyphs(languages={'en'}, strategy=hg.STRATEGY_LOAD)# ^ alphabet will be loaded here for "en" languagehomoglyphs.get_combinations('Ğ³Ñ‹')# ^ alphabet will be loaded here for "ru" language# ['rÑ‹', 'Ğ³Ñ‹']```You can combine `categories`, `languages`, `alphabet` and any strategies as you want. The strategies specify how to handle any characters not already loaded:* `STRATEGY_LOAD`: load category for this character* `STRATEGY_IGNORE`: add character to result* `STRATEGY_REMOVE`: remove character from result### Converting glyphs to ASCII chars```pythonhomoglyphs = hg.Homoglyphs(languages={'en'}, strategy=hg.STRATEGY_LOAD)# converthomoglyphs.to_ascii('Ğ¢Ğ•Ğ¡Ğ¢')# ['TECT']homoglyphs.to_ascii('Ğ¥Ğ 123.') # this is cyrillic "Ñ…" and "Ñ€"# ['XP123.', 'XPI23.', 'XPl23.']# string with chars which can't be converted by default will be ignoredhomoglyphs.to_ascii('Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ»')# []# you can set strategy for removing not converted non-ASCII chars from resulthomoglyphs = hg.Homoglyphs( languages={'en'}, strategy=hg.STRATEGY_LOAD, ascii_strategy=hg.STRATEGY_REMOVE,)homoglyphs.to_ascii('Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ»')# ['o']# also you can set up range of allowed char codes for ascii (0-128 by default):homoglyphs = hg.Homoglyphs( languages={'en'}, strategy=hg.STRATEGY_LOAD, ascii_strategy=hg.STRATEGY_REMOVE, ascii_range=range(ord('a'), ord('z')),)homoglyphs.to_ascii('Ğ¥Ğ 123.')# ['l']homoglyphs.to_ascii('Ñ…Ñ€123.')# ['xpl']```
